alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 04 at 10:34AM CDT until April 07 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Embarras River at Lawrenceville affecting Lawrence County. Little Wabash River below Clay City affecting Richland and Clay Counties. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Embarras River at Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Kelly`s Lake Lane, 1160N, is inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 31.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Monday was 31.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Embarras River Lawrenceville 30.0 31.4 Mon 9 am CDT 31.7 30.9 29.8 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to prepare for flooding. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation.
